name: Double Strike
CardText: Deal 1 damage twice

name: Rest
CardText: This companion gains 3 strength
Notes: This is a slow way to recharge the Aborah.

name: Strike
CardText: Deal 4 damage
Notes: X should be higher than what’s on double strike.

name: Execution
CardText:
Ch1 (costs 1): Deal X damage, remove any block on the target.
Ch2…N (costs 1): Deal Y damage. Execute if below Math.Floor(N /  20) percent health (text replacement, round to whole number)
Notes: Also - The cause them to not attack thing

name: Cathartic Violence
CardText:
Ch1 (costs 1): Deal X damage
Ch2 (costs 1): Deal Y damage
Ch3…N (costs 1) Deal Z damage, gain Xa Strength
Notes: X Y and Z are small. Xa is at least double the amount of strength Aborah loses on attack

name: Summon Orb
CardText: Choose a companion on your team. Give them an orb.

name: Crystallize
CardText: Give a companion 4 block, then 2 extra block for each orb it has.

name: Empower
CardText: For each companion on your team, give it X strength if it has at least one orb.

name: Hit the Wall
CardText: Gain 8 block. Add 2 wounds to this companion’s discard pile. Wounds are unplayable status cards
Notes: X should be a big number. Think Power through from Slay the Spire.

name: Fire Eating
CardText: Shuffle 3 status cards into this companion’s deck that say “Unplayable. When exhausted, deal 6 damage to a random enemy”.

name: Fat Reserve
CardText: Gain X block. When exhausted, this companion heals Y HP.

name: Mood Swings
CardText:
(Whenever this saga is exhausted, advance a chapter and discard it instead)
Ch n % 2 == 1 (costs 1): Apply n+5 thorns to target companion
Ch n % 2 == 0 (costs 1): Apply effect “Team gains n block when this companion takes damage” to target companion
Notes:
Is switching back and forth between chapters questionable? Yes. Does it add some interesting variability to the effect of exhausting the saga? I think also yes. 
Ch3 invuln saga
Can have a keyword for “when exhausted”

name: Cauterize
CardText: Give a companion 5 block and exhaust the top card of their deck.

name: Self-Sharpening Blade
CardText: Deal 3 damage. Deal 3 additional damage next time you play this card.

name: Bellows
CardText: Draw 2 cards, choose 1 of the cards drawn to exhaust.

name: Mechanical Repairs
CardText:
Ch1 (costs 1): Heal target companion for X.
Ch2 (costs 1): The next time you would exhaust a card from target companion’s deck, draw it instead.
Ch3…N (costs 3): Choose a card that was exhausted this combat. You may cast it without paying its mana cost.

name: Iron Forge
CardText:
Ch1 (costs 0): Exhaust two target cards in hand. Conjure a self-sharpening blade into hand.
Ch2…N (costs 1): Exhaust one target card in hand. Increase the damage of all self-sharpening blades by X.

name: Quick Thinking
CardText: Draw 2 cards

name: Simple Scry
CardText: Scry 1. When you scry N, look at the top N cards of a companion’s deck. You can reorder the cards and put any number of the bottom of the draw pile.

name: Brainstorm
CardText: Deal X damage for each card in your hand
Notes: This may be OP with strength.

name: Con Artist
CardText:
Ch1 (costs 0): gain 2 energy
Ch2 (costs 1): draw 3 discard 3
Ch3…N (costs 1): deal n * hand size damage

name: Hide and Seek
CardText:
Ch1 (costs 1): Deal X damage and Gain X block. Shuffle a copy of hide and seek into target deck.
Ch2 (costs 0): Deal Y damage and gain Y block. Reveal the top card of target deck, if the card revealed is “hide and seek”, exhaust it, deal Z damage to all enemies, and give all companions one turn of invulnerability.
Notes: We could give a lotta fun rewards for this one.

name: Word Games
CardText:
Ch1 (costs 0): Discard target card from hand that starts with a letter in the first half of the alphabet. Deal X damage to all enemies and give X block to all companions.
Ch2 (costs 0): Play target card in hand with a name that starts with a letter in the second half of the alphabet without paying its mana cost. Deal Y damage and give Y block to all enemies/companions.
Ch3…N (costs 0): Reveal the top card of a deck. If it starts with the letter ((char) (a) + N)), Deal Z damage to all enemies and give two turns of invulnerability to all teammates.
Notes: fuckin stupid but I had to write it down
